subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Sunday, 08 April, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Mourinho baits Man Utd over title
Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho taunts Sir Alex Ferguson by claiming United are "lucky" not to be playing the Blues next week.



 
St Mirren 0-1 Rangers
Nacho Novo's winner for Rangers delays Celtic's title party and heightens relegation fears for St Mirren.



 
Weir could extend stay at Ibrox
David Weir says he wants to remain with Rangers next season after helping defeat St Mirren.








GOLF




Live - Masters 2007
The final round of the Masters is under way with Tiger Woods launching his bid for a fifth Masters at 1915 BST.



 
Rose and Harrington eye victory
Justin Rose and Padraig Harrington  should both mount a strong challenge in the final round of the 2007 Masters.



 
Rose hangs tough but Tiger looms
Justin Rose will go into the final round at Augusta only one off Stuart Appleby's Masters lead but Tiger Woods is just one adrift too.








MOTORSPORT




Alonso leads home McLaren one-two
Reigning world champion Fernando Alonso secures his first victory for McLaren as he leads home Lewis Hamilton in the Malaysian Grand Prix.



 
Victory a 'dream', says Alonso
World champion Fernando Alonso is in seventh heaven after claiming his maiden win for McLaren in just his second race for the team.



 
Kovalainen happy with first point
Renault rookie Heikki Kovalainen was satisfied to get off the mark with eighth place in Malaysia.








FORMULA ONE

ATHLETICS




Pavey 'rethinks' 10,000m schedule
Britain's Jo Pavey is refusing to panic despite failing to achieve the World Championships 10,000m qualifying time on Saturday.



 
Ohuruogu stunned by appeal loss
Christine Ohuruogu says she is stunned after losing her appeal against her 12-month doping ban.



 
Farah pulls out of Italian event
Britain's Mo Farah will not run in the 10,000m challenge in Italy after picking up a thigh strain last weekend.








CYCLING




Cooke powers to Belgium victory
Welsh cyclist Nicole Cooke wins the Tour of Flanders to extend her World Cup lead.



 
Ballan sprints to win in Flanders
Italian Alessandro Ballan pips Belgium's Leif Hoste to win the Tour of Flanders.



 
Ullrich blood in dope-probe link
A DNA sample taken from Jan Ullrich is matched to blood bags seized in a Spanish doping probe.

Holloway column
